Paper.Title: Maximum entropy Markov models for information extraction and segmentation. In Proc. of ICML-

Section.Paragraph: We study the problem of identifying phrase structure. We formalize it as the problem of combining the outcomes of several different classifiers in a way that provides a coherent inference that satisfies some constraints, and develop two general approaches for it. The first is a Markovian approach that extends standard HMMs to allow the use of a rich observations structure and of general classifiers to model state-observation dependencies. The second is an extension of constraint satisfaction formalisms. We also develop efficient algorithms under both models and study them experimentally in the context of shallow parsing. 1
